## [![DebOps](https://debops.org/images/debops-small.png)](https://debops.org) root_account

<!-- This file was generated by Ansigenome. Do not edit this file directly but

[![Travis CI](https://img.shields.io/travis/debops/ansible-root_account.svg?style=flat)](https://travis-ci.org/debops/ansible-root_account)
[![test-suite](https://img.shields.io/badge/test--suite-ansible--root__account-blue.svg?style=flat)](https://github.com/debops/test-suite/tree/master/ansible-root_account/)
[![Ansible Galaxy](https://img.shields.io/badge/galaxy-debops.root_account-660198.svg?style=flat)](https://galaxy.ansible.com/debops/root_account)


The `debops.root_account` Ansible role can be used to manage the system root
account and generate SSH private keys for use on other hosts.

### Installation

This role requires at least Ansible `v2.0.0`. To install it, run:

```Shell
ansible-galaxy install debops.root_account
```

### Documentation

More information about `debops.root_account` can be found in the
[official debops.root_account documentation](https://docs.debops.org/en/latest/ansible/roles/ansible-root_account/docs/).


### Role dependencies

- `debops.secret`

### Are you using this as a standalone role without DebOps?

You may need to include missing roles from the [DebOps common
playbook](https://github.com/debops/debops-playbooks/blob/master/playbooks/common.yml)
into your playbook.

[Try DebOps now](https://debops.org/) for a complete solution to run your Debian-based infrastructure.
